newsitem.title: CHINA: China issues rules to curb foreign waste imports.
newsitem.headline: China issues rules to curb foreign waste imports.

text.p: China's Ministry of Communications has introduced rules in a bid to curb imports of foreign waste, the Xinhua news agency said on Wednesday.
The new regulations, which went into effect on Tuesday, were aimed at complementing a crackdown on illegal shipments of hazardous garbage from abroad.
Imports of foreign garbage have rankled China since it found earlier this year what it said was hazardous waste in shipments from the United States originally listed as recyclable material.
The new rules require shippers to get a waste import licence from the State Environmental Protection Agency and obtain a certificate of approval for the waste from a state-approved inspection agency.
Shippers would also have to show a copy of the trade contract for the waste and give the detailed name and address of the receiver, it said.
Shippers who failed to meet the requirements would be forced to bear all the costs of transporting the waste back, it said.
